titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Entre Nous Dramatic and Literary Association membership roll 1977.118
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.unittitle: Entre Nous Dramatic and Literary Association membership roll

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Entre Nous Dramatic and Literary Association

did.abstract: Membership roll of Entre Nous Dramatic and Literary Association of Brooklyn. The roll lists each member's name and address. Dated circa 1867.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Entre Nous Dramatic and Literary Association of Brooklyn was an amateur theatrical club formed by residents of southern Brooklyn in 1867. The club split in 1871, with one faction becoming a social club under the name of Entre Nous and another adopting the name of Amaranth and continuing to stage theatrical productions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Membership roll of Entre Nous Dramatic and Literary Association of Brooklyn. The roll lists each member's name and address. Dated circa 1867.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Entre Nous Dramatic and Literary Association membership roll, 1977.118, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Daniel B. Thompson, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
